oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Elizabeth Schlappi Roy Acuff collection audio tapes
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Radio programs recorded off air in 1956 by Roy Acuff biographer Elizabeth Schlappi.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Royal Crown Cola Grand Ole Opry from 1956-02-11 -- Show opening with voice over theme announcement by Ott Divine and Louie Buck -- New River Train (Roy Acuff and the Smoky Mountain Boys) -- RC Cola commercial (Louie Buck) -- Bile Dem Cabbage Down (Fruit Jar Drinkers with square dance calls) -- introduction of Slim Whitman -- I'm A Fool (Slim Whitman) -- Introduction of Kitty Wells -- I've Kissed You My Last Time (Kitty Wells) -- Introduction of Bill Monroe -- Put My Little Shoes Away (Bill Monroe and His Bluegrass Boys) poor reception and signal interruption -- Uncle Noah's Ark (Pap's Jug Band) -- I Want To Be Loved By You (Johnnie and Jack with Kitty Wells) excerpt -- Lights In The Valley (Roy Acuff and the Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Brilliancy (Howdy Forrester-fiddle) -- Closing Theme With Voice Over- incomplete -- Unidentified program -- I'll Fly Away (Roy Acuff and the Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Dunbar Cave Show from 1956-03-23 -- Show Opening Announcement (Tom)-- Square Dance -- Dunbar Cave schedule given by Roy Acuff -- Stuck Up Blues (Roy Acuff and the Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Introduction Of The Wilburn Brothers -- Mixed Up Medley (The Wilburn Brothers) -- Square Dance with calls (Howdy Forrester-fiddle) -- Reading Of Guest List And Personal Appearance Schedule (Lester Wilburn) -- Curly Headed Baby (Bashful Brother Oswald) -- Teddy Wilburn mentions Mae B. Axton visiting the show from Florida ??? -- You're Not Play Love (The Wilburn Brothers) -- Wagoner / Square Dance (Howdy Forrester fiddle and Johnny Ford calling) -- Lost John (Jimmie Riddle-harmonica) -- closing theme and comments from Roy Acuff -- Unidentified program -- Mountain Dew (Bashful Brother Oswald) -- Imitations (Simon Crum) excerpt -- Riding Old Paint (Sam and Kirk McGee) -- Unidentified Fiddle Tune (The Gully Jumpers) excerpt -- I Learned It All From You (Jean Shepard) excerpt.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Grand ole opry (Radio program); Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Fruit Jar Drinkers (Musical group); Whitman, Slim, 1924-2013; Wells, Kitty; Monroe, Bill, 1911-1996; Blue Grass Boys (Musical group); Pap's Jug Band (Musical group); Forrester, Howdy, 1922-1987; Johnnie and Jack (Musical group); Anglin, Jack, 1916-1963 ; Wright, Johnnie, 1914-2011; Wilburn Brothers (Musical group); Kirby, Pete; Riddle, Jimmie; McGee Brothers; Dunbar Cave (Tenn. : Cave);
